humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that 2 out of 12 lymph nodes are positive for metastasis, and one of these is in the subclavicular region (which is considered a regional lymph node). Based on Rule 13, N3 indicates metastases in 4 or more axillary lymph nodes, or in in-transit, satellite, or micrometastases (N3mi) in 4 or more lymph nodes, or in ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes in the absence of axillary lymph node metastases. In this case, the presence of metastases in a regional lymph node (subclavicular) qualifies the N stage as N3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has 2/12 positive lymph nodes (found in the subclavicular region), which indicates a pathologic N1 stage. The report does not mention extracapsular invasion, so we cannot consider that in the staging. The substaging information is not provided, so we cannot make a more specific N1 substage prediction.
